info.title: Toggl API
info.description: The Toggl API allows developers to interact with Toggl's time tracking service programmatically. It provides endpoints for managing time entries, projects, clients, tags, and user information. With this API, you can automate time tracking, generate detailed reports, and integrate Toggl with other tools and services.

get.description: Returns details for the current user.
Load running time entry for the current user.

post.description: Creates a new organization with a single workspace and assigns current user as the organization owner

get.description: Get all organizations a given user is part of.
Returns organization name and current pricing plan

authorization_updated_at.description: A timestamp when the authorization user session object was last updated.

clients.description: Clients, null if with_related_data was not set to true or if the user does not have any clients

projects.description: Projects, null if with_related_data was not set to true or if the user does not have any projects

archived.description: true, if the client is archived

creator_id.description: The ID of the user who created the client

integration_ext_id.description: The external ID of the linked entity in the external system (e.g. JIRA/SalesForce)

integration_ext_type.description: The external type of the linked entity in the external system (e.g. JIRA/SalesForce)

integration_provider.description: The provider (e.g. JIRA/SalesForce) that has an entity linked to this Toggl Track entity

permissions.description: List of authorization permissions for this client.

example.name: AGL Podcast Creation and Related Tasks
AGL Power Workshops (Creation and Live Call)

active.description: Whether the project is active or archived

billable.description: Whether the project is billable, premium feature

auto_estimates.description: Whether estimates are based on task hours, premium feature

integration_ext_id.description: The external ID of the linked entity in the external system (e.g. JIRA/SalesForce)

integration_ext_type.description: The external type of the linked entity in the external system (e.g. JIRA/SalesForce)

integration_provider.description: The provider (e.g. JIRA/SalesForce) that has an entity linked to this Toggl Track entity

APIErrorString.example: Start time year must be between 2006 and 2030

billable.description: Whether the time entry is marked as billable, optional, default false

created_with.description: Must be provided when creating a time entry and should identify the service/application used to create it

duration.description: Time entry duration. For running entries should be negative, preferable -1

duronly.description: Deprecated: Used to create a time entry with a duration but without a stop time. This parameter can be ignored.

shared_with_user_ids.description: List of user IDs to share this time entry with

start_date.description: If provided during creation, the date part will take precedence over the date part of "start". Format: 2006-11-07

stop.description:
Stop time in UTC, can be omitted if it's still running or created with "duration".
If "stop" and "duration" are provided, values must be consistent (start + duration == stop)

tags.description: Names of tags to add/remove. If name does not exist as tag, one will be created automatically

uid.description: Time Entry creator ID, legacy field

user_id.description: Time Entry creator ID, if omitted will use the requester user ID

TagAction.description: Used when updating an existing time entry

is_multi_workspace_enabled.description: Is true when the organization option is_multi_workspace_enabled is set

suspended_at.description: Whether the organization is currently suspended

max_workspaces.description: Maximum number of workspaces allowed for the organization

admin.description: Whether the requester is an admin of the organization

owner.description: Whether the requester is a the owner of the organization

pricing_plan_name.description: The subscription plan name the org is currently on. Free or any plan name coming from payment provider

pricing_plan_enterprise.description: The subscription plan is an enterprise plan

max_data_retention_days.description: How far back free workspaces in this org can access data.

trial.description: Whether the organization's subscription is currently on trial

trial_available.description: When a trial is available for this organization

next_payment_date.description: When the trial payment is due

last_pricing_plan_id.description: What was the previous plan before the trial

can_have_trial.description: True, if neither the organization nor the owner has never had a trial before

UnauthorizedResponse.description: User is unauthorized to use the API

BadRequestResponse.description: Returned when the user made a bad request

application/json.example: Start time year must be between 2006 and 2030

TimeEntriesResponse.description: Returns a list of time entries

with_related_data.name: with_related_data
with_related_data.description: Retrieve user related data (clients, projects, tasks, tags, workspaces, time entries, etc.)

since.name: since
since.description: Get entries modified since this date using UNIX timestamp, including deleted ones.

before.name: before
before.description: Get entries with start time before the given date.

start_date.name: start_date
start_date.description: Get entries with start time from the given time. To be used with end_date.

end_date.name: end_date
end_date.description: Get entries with start time until the given time. To be used with start_date.

meta.name: meta
meta.description: Should the response contain meta data such as `client_name`, `project_name`, `project_color`, `project_active`, `project_billable`, `user_name`, and `user_avatar_url`.

include_sharing.name: include_sharing
include_sharing.description: Include sharing details in the response

BasicAuth.description: The Authorization header is constructed either using the email and password or the API token and the string literal 'api_token'.
